cs.SD, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with speech enhancement using signal processing techniques, which falls under the scope of several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

- cs.SD (Sound): This sub-category deals with research related to sound and audio processing, which is directly relevant to the proposed speech enhancement method. 
- cs.SI (Speech and Natural Language Processing): This sub-category deals with research related to speech and natural language processing, which is the primary application of the proposed method. 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): This sub-category deals with research related to computational linguistics, which is indirectly relevant to the proposed method as it involves processing of speech signals. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): This sub-category deals with research related to machine learning, which is indirectly relevant to the proposed method as it involves the use of nonnegative matrix factorization (NMF) for speech enhancement. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): This sub-category deals with research related to multimedia processing, which is indirectly relevant to the proposed method as it involves processing of speech signals.
